etymology.description: Depicts a snake -> borrowed for insects and similar creatures -> 虺(虺) (huǐ, "snake") created to reclaim original snake meaning
etymology.interpretation: The character 虫(蟲) (chóng, "insect") initially depicted a snake due to its winding appearance. Over time, it was borrowed to refer to insects and similar small creatures, diverging from its original meaning.
etymology.simplification: The character was retained in simplified Chinese, simplifying the three worms represented in 蟲 to one in 虫.

examples.chinese: 花园里发现了许多虫(花園里發現了許多蟲)。
examples.pinyin: Huāyuán lǐ fāxiàn le xǔduō chóng。
examples.english: Many insects were discovered in the garden.

examples.chinese: 一只虫爬上树叶(一隻蟲爬上樹葉)，引起了孩子们的注意(引起了孩子們的注意)。
examples.pinyin: Yī zhī chóng pá shàng shùyè, yǐnqǐ le háizimen de zhùyì。
examples.english: A bug crawled onto a leaf, attracting the children's attention.
